definition: rhyming word ending a line of verse/rhyme
the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role

sentences.english: The level tone feet of the metrical verse embodies the harmony of parole of language.
sentences.chinese: 平聲韻腳充分體現出了言語與語言之間的和諧互動。

sentences.english: It helps them memorize the months with a catchy rhyme.
sentences.chinese: 它以朗朗上口的韻腳來幫助他們記起月份。

sentences.english: The grade two student's rhythm awareness is better than their phonemic awareness.
sentences.chinese: 初中二年級學生的英語韻腳意識的發展好於音位意識。

sentences.english: Once published , his work became famous for the absence of rhyme at the end of each line.
sentences.chinese: 他的書一出版，就因爲每行末缺乏韻腳而聞名。

definition: regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
meaning of word/sense
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
to rhyme/sometimes written 壓韻|压韵
pun/play on words
simple/easy to understand
syllable
faulty wording/mispronunciation due to a speech defect
to compose a piece of music
pitch of voice (high or low)/pitch (of a musical note)/tone
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
rhetoric/flowery language
subject of literary work
dual/duality/antithesis/coupled phrases (as rhetorical device)/spouse
verse
(music) staff/stave
